skill.name: reactome-database
skill.description: Query Reactome REST API for pathway analysis, enrichment, gene-pathway mapping, disease pathways, molecular interactions, expression analysis, for systems biology studies.
skill.summary: Query Reactome REST API for pathway analysis, enrichment, gene-pathway mapping, disease pathways, mo...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Legitimate bioinformatics skill for querying Reactome pathway database. Network access is limited to official Reactome API endpoints (reactome.org). Filesystem access is restricted to user-specified gene list files and result outputs only. No credential or environment variable access. Static scanner detected documentation examples as code execution (false positives).

content.user_title: Query Reactome pathways and perform enrichment analysis
content.value_statement: Researching biological pathways requires searching multiple databases and performing statistical analysis. This skill provides direct access to Reactome database REST API for pathway enrichment analysis, gene-pathway mapping, and molecular interaction queries.
actual_capabilities: Query pathway information by stable identifier (R-HSA-xxxxx format)
Perform overrepresentation analysis on gene or protein lists
Search pathways by keyword or term
Get participating molecules in specific pathways
Analyze gene expression data with statistical results
Retrieve analysis results using tokens valid for 7 days
limitations: Requires internet connection to access Reactome API
Analysis tokens valid for 7 days only
reactome2py Python package is not actively maintained
Rate limits may apply for large batch queries

use_cases.title: Identify enriched pathways
use_cases.description: Submit gene lists from differential expression experiments to find significantly enriched biological pathways.

use_cases.title: Cross-species analysis
use_cases.description: Map non-human gene identifiers to human pathways using species projection for comparative studies.

use_cases.title: Pathway visualization
use_cases.description: Generate browser URLs with analysis tokens to visualize results in Reactome Pathway Browser interface.

prompt_templates.title: Basic pathway query
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the reactome-database skill to query pathway R-HSA-69278 and show its description, species, and participating entities.

prompt_templates.title: Gene enrichment
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform pathway enrichment analysis on these genes: TP53, BRCA1, EGFR, MYC, CDK1. Show significant pathways with FDR values.

prompt_templates.title: Pathway search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search Reactome for pathways related to glycolysis. List the top 5 results with their identifiers and descriptions.

prompt_templates.title: Expression analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze gene expression data from my TSV file. Which pathways are significantly enriched (FDR < 0.05)?

output_examples.input: Analyze these genes: TP53, BRCA1, EGFR, MYC
Search for pathways related to apoptosis

best_practices: Submit gene lists as plain text files with one identifier per line for reliable processing
Store analysis tokens to retrieve results later without re-submitting gene lists
Filter results by FDR < 0.05 to focus on statistically significant pathways
anti_patterns: Submitting identifiers one at a time instead of batching them together
Ignoring species differences when analyzing non-human gene lists
Not checking for mapping failures when identifiers are not found in Reactome

faq.question: What identifier formats does Reactome accept?
faq.answer: Reactome accepts UniProt accessions, gene symbols, Ensembl IDs, EntrezGene IDs, ChEBI IDs, and other standard formats. The API auto-detects the identifier type.

faq.question: How long are analysis tokens valid?
faq.answer: Analysis tokens remain valid for 7 days. Use them to retrieve results without re-submitting gene lists.

faq.question: Can I analyze non-human species?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the projection endpoint to map mouse, rat, or other species identifiers to human pathways for comparison.

faq.question: Is my gene data stored on Reactome servers?
faq.answer: Reactome stores analysis results associated with tokens for 7 days. No personal data is retained beyond this period.

faq.question: Why are some genes not mapped?
faq.answer: Genes may not map if they are not represented in Reactome database or if identifiers are malformed. Check the unmapped entities in results.

faq.question: How does this compare to other tools like KEGG or GO?
faq.answer: Reactome provides manually curated human pathways with detailed molecular interactions. It complements other databases with higher annotation quality for specific pathways.
